DescriptionText.Text: Event: Bonding
%+d Community Morale.
A few hours without any threats of homicide or maiming. It's not paradise, but I've seen worse days. - %1$s
Don't laugh, it's better than people settling their differences with fists. - %1$s
Who knew we had enough people with musical talent to start a jazz quartet? Okay, maybe "talent" is too strong a word, but at least it's keeping people entertained. - %1$s
Soooo... dunno who brought it, buuuut... somebody brought out a bottle of 20-year-old single malt. Turns out? 'Sa goooood team building exercise. Also turns out? Scotch is kin'a awesome. - %1$s
Just wanted to say, it's good to have you here. We appreciate everything you do for us. - %1$s
No one's allowed to talk unless they have the Talking Stick. - %1$s
It might sound corny, but I've been encouraging people to share stories about where they're from. Turns out people have a lot more in common than they might think. - %1$s
It's amazing how much a simple "thank you" now and again can smooth things over. - %1$s
It's funny how something as simple as a few days of nice weather can improve everybody's mood. - %1$s
Monitoring community morale.
%+d Community Morale.
People are getting along pretty well now. %1$s has shaken off the fatigue and wants to go do something.
No longer tired.
%+d Community Morale.
That feast really improved group morale. -%1$s
%+d Community Morale.
People are celebrating having cleared that infestation. -%1$s
%+d Community Morale.
I don't like what I've been seeing around here lately. We don't have to be ruthless to survive. - %1$s

SummaryText.Text: %1$s wants us to help other survivors.

DescriptionText.Text: Taking a moral stand.
Caring personalities object to selfish actions (e.g., refusing to help someone in need).
Thinks that's nonsense. Our top priority has to be taking care of ourselves.
Event: Ally Hurt
%+d Cases of Medicine
%+d Community Morale.
%1$s was out scouting. Make it home, but just barely. Had to burn some medicine on the wound. -%2$s

Look, I'll make you a deal, okay? You don't ask me how I got this little, ahh, injury, let me take some medicine from the stocks on the QT, and I'll give you my share at lunch for the next week. Deal? - %1$s
Oof... thanks... I really needed that. Don't worry, I feel much better now. - %1$s
I'm not stealing it, I'm just... borrowing it. Honest. That's all. Look, I need it, okay? - %1$s
See? What'd I tell ya? Couple pills, some bandages, good as new. - %1$s
It's not a bite! Relax! I just need a little bit from our medical stocks and I'll be right as rain. - %1$s
IOU some medicine. Don't worry, I'll be fine. - %1$s
Had to take some meds from the stores. Twisted my ankle pretty bad out there. Sure you don't mind. - %1$s
Thought %1$s was a goner out there, but I guess it looked worse than it was. We patched it up with a little medicine, should be fine in no time. -%2$s
Should recover just fine.
Event: Emergency Repairs
%+d Community Morale.

TutorialText.Text: Need 10 Materials

DescriptionText.Text: Damn good thing the zombies tore this place up. We gotta fix this before people start getting sick.
We're gonna have to tear down all of this and rebuild it. Unless you want the place to fall down around our ears.

SummaryText.Text: Like we don't have enough problems?

DescriptionText.Text: Hey, listen, sometimes stuff breaks. It's nobody's fault, it just is what it is.
It's gonna take more materials than we expected to fix these walls.
%+d Construction Materials
%+d Community Morale.
Went through more materials than usual reinforcing the wall.

SummaryText.Text: I hear them clawing at night.

DescriptionText.Text: Listen, we can do this fast, we can do it good, and we can do it cheap. Pick two.

SummaryText.Text: If it's worth doing, it's worth doing right.

DescriptionText.Text: This is what we get for outsourcing American manufacturing jobs. Guess we gotta do all this again.
Maybe it'll make a difference and maybe it won't, but I figure better safe than sorry.
Event: Zombie Hunt
%+d Cases of Ammunition
%+d Community Morale.

TutorialText.Text: Good thing we had ammo.

DescriptionText.Text: %1$s and %2$s wiped out a bunch of zombies before they became a threat. Cost us some ammo, but the morale boost's worth it! -%3$s
Well, that's a passel of zeds we don't gotta worry about any more! - %1$s
Finally killed that one-armed bastard that killed Frankie and the rest way back at the start. I know they say these things can't think, but I swear that thing was stalking us. - %1$s
Took %1$s out skeet shooting. Burned a little ammo, but it was worth it to blow off some steam. - %2$s
Man, I had no IDEA assault rifles made killing zombies so much fun. Gonna have to do that again. - %1$s
That was intense! Gonna be riding this high for a while. Go team! - %1$s
Yeah, we burned through a lot of ammo. Totally worth it to bring %1$s home safe, though. - %2$s
Dude, I've never seen anybody kill as many zeds as %2$s! It was freaking unreal! Totally worth all the ammo we used. - %1$s

SummaryText.Text: You're going for the record, Alex!

DescriptionText.Text: Okay, maybe we went a little overkill on the shooting... but these new guns are so cool! - %1$s
You shoulda seen %2$s, man! Dumped, like, three whole clips into one of those big boys. I didn't think that thing would ever go down! It's epic! - %1$s
Led the way.
Feeling kind of heroic.
%+d Cases of Ammunition
%+d Community Morale.
%+d Cases of Ammunition
%1$s came running back home with some zeds in hot pursuit. Couldn't do much to help because we're out of ammo. -%2$s
Narrowly escaped. Seems fine.
Event: Meds Tossed
%+d Cases of Medicine
%+d Community Morale.
These things last a while past the expiration date, but not forever. -%1$s
These meds are older than your mom. Yeah. I went there. -%1$s
Wine should have a vintage. Clothing can be vintage. Antibiotics should not be vintage. -%1$s
"Ugh. Me Lurgh. Me make medicine with fire. Fire good magic. Fire keep saber-tooth tiger away." -The guy who made this batch of meds.
Any bug these would treat has probably evolved an immunity already. -%1$s
Well, these are about as useful as sugar pills now. -%1$s
Good thing nobody took any of these yet. God knows what weird side effects they'd have after all this time. -%1$s
Seriously? When these things expired the Spice Girls were still big. -%1$s
Doesn't anybody check the dates on these bottles? All this goes in the trash now. -%1$s
You know expired meds are worse than nothing, right? Ugh, throw all these out! -%1$s
Event: Mishandled Gun
%+d Community Morale.

TutorialText.Text: Maybe we need some FIREARMS TRAINING.

DescriptionText.Text: It just went off! I swear I wasn't screwing around. I definitely wasn't trying to shoot anybody! - %1$s
Geez, that thing coulda exploded in my hand! The hell is wrong with people? - %1$s
Holy crap, that was loud! Did you guys know that was gonna be so loud? - %1$s
It's okay everybody! False alarm! Nobody got hurt, it's all good. - %1$s
Dammit, %1$s, you want to stop wasting our ammo AND drawing zombie attention? Clear your chamber before you start cleaning your gun. - %2$s
Was lucky nobody got hurt.
%+d Community Morale.

TutorialText.Text: Maybe we need some FIREARMS TRAINING.

DescriptionText.Text: Okay, I know I screwed up, and I'm sorry, but at least nobody got hurt... right? - %1$s
Jesus... somebody coulda died there. We gotta be more careful. - %1$s
Woo! That one'll wake you up in the morning, huh? Damn near had a heart attack. - %1$s
Yeah, no, I'm fine. Least I will be when my hands stop shaking. - %1$s
%+d Community Morale.

TutorialText.Text: Maybe we need some FIREARMS TRAINING.

DescriptionText.Text: I am SO sorry, %2$s. You have to know it was an accident. I would never, ever do anything like that intentionally. - %1$s
Huh. So that's what they mean by "no such thing as an unloaded gun." Sorry %2$s. - %1$s
In my defense, I was drunk at the time. - %1$s
This right here is why giving everybody a gun is a bad idea. - %2$s
I'm too tired to try to hide it. I vomited blood today. I don't know if I'm going to make it. - %1$s
May be a danger to the community.
Troubled by this situation.
The better our medicine supply, facilities, and advisors, the higher the Recovery odds.
%1$s has been feverish and delirious for much of the day. - %2$s
May be a danger to the community.
Troubled by this situation.
The better our medicine supply, facilities, and advisors, the higher the Recovery odds.
Event: Bickering
%+d Community Morale.
Did nobody see my name on the fucking hot dogs? Seriously? I had plans for those! Special plans. Assholes. - %1$s
Whichever one of you dicks thought it would be funny to replace my tomato juice with sriracha sauce: vengeance is coming. Oh yes. You will suffer. - %1$s

Look, that "dinner" last night was revolting. Everybody knows it. I nominate we institute an "opt-out" program where people can take a little extra from the stores if they don't want to eat this deep-fried crap.

Really people? A candy dish full of pushpins? I'm sure they're super-useful and all, but some of us are coming back from supply runs tired and hungry and just want a mouthful of delicious candy, not tetanus of the mouth. - %1$s

Guys, we've got maybe the last tub of spicy garlic hummus in the world in our kitchen. That's pretty awesome, right? I'd love it if everybody got to eat some, but if a certain someone keeps dipping their fingers in it, nobody's going to get to enjoy it. -%1$s
Whoever keeps leaving passive-aggressive notes around the kitchen, please knock it off. We're all dealing with the same shit, and nobody cares about your petty complaints. - %1$s

People, how are we going through this much butter? Is somebody eating it like candy bars? Are you trying to construct a hilarious new zombie trap? Or are you just smearing it all over yourself and running naked through the streets screaming "I am the queen of dairy!" -%1$s

Look, I'm all for sharing freely, but whoever keeps eating my soy cheese could you please stop? I'm lactose intolerant, I can't eat the other kinds. Just a little pretend cheese, that's all I ask! - %1$s

Somebody used peanuts in our dinner last night. Now, I posted that list of common food allergies in the kitchen for a REASON, people, so let's all try to be a little more considerate of others, okay? - %1$s <-- Nobody here is allergic to peanuts, will you please stop harping on it? - %2$s
Not happy about how things are going.
Took the brunt of the abuse.
%+d Community Morale.
With food supplies scarce, everyone's on edge, but %1$s and %2$s really crossed the line. -%3$s
Got into it over our food supply.
Got into it over our food supply.
%+d Community Morale.

TutorialText.Text: People need to have somewhere to sleep!

DescriptionText.Text: I can't keep going out there if I never get any rest when I'm here. It's gonna get me killed. - %1$s
Upset about not having anywhere to sleep.
Concerned that this problem persists.
%+d Community Morale.
Dude, I know we don't have an infirmary here, but do you have to change those nasty-ass bandages in public? Some of us are trying to eat! -%1$s

SummaryText.Text: People don't need to see that!

DescriptionText.Text: More arguing in the community. Things are too dangerous to not have an infirmary. -%1$s
No, I'm not letting you cut out my appendix! Not only are you not even close to being a doctor, we don't even have an infirmary! - %1$s
Somebody put the antihistamines where the pseudoephedrine is supposed to go. Good thing I noticed, or I'd have killed myself trying to treat sniffles. We need a goddamn infirmary. - %1$s
Excuse me all to hell for "keeping you up at night moaning." In case you didn't know, gut wounds HURT. Where else am I supposed to recover? Not like we have an infirmary here. - %1$s
Can we please get an infirmary in here? I'm tired of having to mop up blood in the common areas. - %1$s
Took me almost 20 minutes to find a first aid kit yesterday. If it had been a more severe injury, somebody could have died. - %1$s
That's a fucking bread knife. You are not getting anywhere near me with that thing! Christ, we need an infirmary. - %1$s
Not happy about how things are going.
%+d Community Morale.
This sucks. Without a Medical Area, how am I supposed to heal up? -%1$s
Not happy about how things are going.
Troubled by this situation.
%+d Community Morale.
This sucks. Without a Medical Area, how am I supposed to heal up? -%1$s
Not happy about how things are going.
Troubled by this situation.
%+d Community Morale.
It's like high school all over again, except the glee club wants to eat me. - %1$s
Gather supplies, maintain our home base, staff facilities, kill zombies--when the hell do we get a break? - %1$s
Christ, will you just shut up? You're not everybody's personal shrink. I don't want to "open up" or "share my feelings," so just get lost. - %1$s
%+d Community Morale.
Look at how things are going lately. I can't kid myself anymore. We're doomed and anyone who says otherwise is full of it. - %1$s
The only thing that's ever gonna change is when the last of us finally die and there's nothing left on the planet but the zombies. - %1$s
Bringing everyone down.
%+d Community Morale.
%+d Daily Rations of Food

TutorialText.Text: Dangers of sad community members.

DescriptionText.Text: %1$s has been binge eating to deal with the stress. Fucker ate the last of the snack cakes, too. %2$s

Sorry, dudes. Didn't mean to eat all that grub, I just found the last stash of Acapulco Gold maybe in the world, and I figured "hey, it'd suck to die with this righteous bud unsmoked," and, well, you can kinda see what happened from there. - %1$s
Oh... was I not supposed to eat all that? Sorry, nobody showed me the ration schedule. - %1$s
Uhh... it looked like it was all about to go bad. I swear. So I figured it was better for somebody to eat everything than to let it spoil. - %1$s
What? Never heard of comfort food? Don't you judge me. - %1$s
I just couldn't stop myself. Now I feel like I'm gonna be sick. - %1$s
Did some serious stress eating.
%+d Community Morale.

TutorialText.Text: Low Morale puts your community at greater risk of depression, violence, and despair.

DescriptionText.Text: If somebody wants to give me a reason to not just lay down and die, I'd love to hear it. -%1$s
The longer this goes on, the more I think the ones who got turned were the lucky ones. -%1$s
I'm not even afraid of getting killed by zombies any more. It's the long, slow death that scares me. Starving, or sick, or lying broken-legged in a muddy ditch somewhere. Gives me chills. -%1$s
What the hell makes Lily so special, anyways? Don't ever see her risking her ass out there. -%1$s
Spare us the inspirational speeches. We all know how bad it is out there, and pretty words ain't gonna make it better. -%1$s
No, I will not "lay off the doom and gloom." I'm just being a realist. -%1$s
Jesus, will you give it a rest with the doom and gloom? We all know things are bad, you don't have to keep reminding us. -%2$s
For the last time, asshole, nobody's going to help you rescue your action figure collection! We got enough problems already. -%1$s
Losing patience with this nonsense.
Troubled by this situation.
%+d Community Morale.
Hey, %1$s, I've got a movie quote for you: 'Fuck you, asshole' - %2$s

SummaryText.Text: I've had enough of your crap!

DescriptionText.Text: So help me, %1$s, if you say one more thing about how Foghat sucks, I will kick your ass! - %2$s
Hey, it's not my fault! %2$s keeps trimming {[2:mn]his}{[2:f]her} toenails while I'm trying to eat. It's sick!

SummaryText.Text: I just can't take it any more!

DescriptionText.Text: I don't care if you think it scares the zombies away, %2$s, next time you start yodeling at two in the morning I'm going to strangle you! - %1$s

SummaryText.Text: Shut up shut up shut up!

DescriptionText.Text: %2$s snores. You all know it. Not a one of you wouldn't do the same thing. - %1$s
What else is there to say? %2$s is a raging prick. I'm not sorry. - %1$s

SummaryText.Text: We just don't like each other.

DescriptionText.Text: You stay the fuck away from %2$s, %1$s. Next time it won't just be an argument.
You don't stop talking shit behind my back, %2$s, and I will cut you like a prison bitch. Sweet dreams, motherfucker. - %1$s
Stirring up trouble.
Took the brunt of the abuse.
%+d Community Morale.
Hey, %1$s, I've got a movie quote for you: 'Fuck you, asshole' - %2$s

SummaryText.Text: I've had enough of your crap!

DescriptionText.Text: So help me, %1$s, if you say one more thing about how Foghat sucks, I will kick your ass! - %2$s
Hey, it's not my fault! %2$s keeps trimming {[2:mn]his}{[2:f]her} toenails while I'm trying to eat. It's sick!

SummaryText.Text: I just can't take it any more!

DescriptionText.Text: I don't care if you think it scares the zombies away, %2$s, next time you start yodeling at two in the morning I'm going to strangle you! - %1$s

SummaryText.Text: Shut up shut up shut up!

DescriptionText.Text: %2$s snores. You all know it. Not a one of you wouldn't do the same thing. - %1$s
What else is there to say? %2$s is a raging prick. I'm not sorry. - %1$s

SummaryText.Text: We just don't like each other.

DescriptionText.Text: You stay the fuck away from %1$s, %2$s. Next time it won't just be an argument.
You stay the fuck away from %1$s, %2$s. Next time it won't just be an argument.
You don't stop talking shit behind my back, %2$s, and I will cut you like a prison bitch. Sweet dreams, motherfucker. - %1$s
Stirring up trouble.
Took the brunt of the abuse.
%+d Community Morale.
%+d Cases of Ammunition

TutorialText.Text: Low Morale causes your community members to act out.

DescriptionText.Text: Oh, like you all have never played "Zombie Celebrity Lookalike Shooting Gallery." Actually, I'm pretty sure one of them was the real Suzanne Somers. - %1$s
Just testing. Turns out we were right. You CAN'T kill them except by destroying the head. - %1$s
You call it "wasting ammo," I call it "sighting in." It's sniper shit, I wouldn't expect you to understand. - %1$s
You all saw it! I didn't have a choice! That cow would've killed us all! - %1$s
%1$s isn't allowed to go on sentry duty without somebody checking their breath for tequila. How many mags did they blow through and not hit a single damn thing? - %2$s
Geez, %1$s, I know you hated high school, but did you have to shoot out every single window in the place? We need that ammo for zombie killing. - %2$s
Wasted ammunition blowing off steam.
Stirring up trouble.
Troubled by this situation.
%+d Community Morale.
Christ, will you just shut up? You're not everybody's personal shrink. I don't want to "open up" or "share my feelings," so just get lost. - %1$s
Sometimes, out of nowhere, my hands just start shaking. How am I supposed to shoot straight with shaky hands? - %1$s
%+d Community Morale.
Look at how things are going lately. I can't kid myself anymore. We're doomed and anyone who says otherwise is full of it. - %1$s
Having trouble keeping it together.
Losing patience with this nonsense.
Troubled by this situation.

TutorialText.Text: People will start to flee.

DescriptionText.Text: We need to do something to turn this around or we're going to lose everyone. -%1$s.
Concerned about our lack of construction materials.
We have to believe in each other. That's the only way this works. -%2$s.
Has left the community.
I'm continuing to hear stories of flu outbreaks. Having a good stockpile of medicine and decent medical facilities is all we can do. -%1$s.
Happy that you've stockpiled meds.
I'm continuing to hear stories of flu outbreaks. We'd better stock up on medicine. -%1$s.

SummaryText.Text: We need to stock up on medicine.

DescriptionText.Text: Pointing out that we need a medicine stockpile.
%+d Community Morale.
Soon as anything contagious hits us, it'll spread like wildfire if we don't have an Infirmary. - %1$s

Console_Command.Command: LOG: NpcEnclave recruited Missing community member

DescriptionText.Text: Thought you'd want to know I made it. I met up with some good people. I have a new home now. - %1$s

Console_Command.Command: LOG: NpcEnclave recruited Expelled community member

DescriptionText.Text: Thought you were hot shit kicking me out, right? Well, it turns out I don't need you assholes. - %1$s

Console_Command.Command: LOG: NpcEnclave recruited Loyal community member

DescriptionText.Text: Thought you'd want to know I made it. I met up with some good people. I have a new home now. - %1$s
%+d Community Morale.
With so many hordes out there, our people are in constant danger. - %1$s
Their numbers make them dangerous.
Nearly killed.
Fled from a horde. Now missing.
Fled from a horde. Now missing.
%+d Community Morale.

TutorialText.Text: We should consider a FITNESS REGIMEN at an TRAINING AREA.

DescriptionText.Text: Those SWAT zombies can wear you out and you gotta fight 'em hand-to-hand. - %1$s
Resistant to gunfire.
Nearly killed.
%+d Community Morale.

TutorialText.Text: Maybe COMBAT TRAINING at a DOJO would help.

DescriptionText.Text: It takes some real hand-to-hand combat skill to take these on. - %1$s
Fast, deadly, and nearly immune to gunfire.
Nearly killed.
%+d Community Morale.

TutorialText.Text: OUTPOSTS could take him out before he reaches us.

DescriptionText.Text: Those things are toxic. - %1$s
Not all that hard to kill, but they're highly infectious.
Nearly killed.
%+d Community Morale.

TutorialText.Text: We need to make sure we're well fortified.

DescriptionText.Text: We'd better do something. I've seen them leap walls like they were nothing. - %1$s.

SummaryText.Text: We need ammo to deal with it.

DescriptionText.Text: Fast, vicious, tough in melee, and hard to shoot.
Nearly killed.
%+d Community Morale.

TutorialText.Text: We need to make sure we're well fortified.

DescriptionText.Text: We'd better do something. I've seen them leap walls like they were nothing. - %1$s.
Fast, deadly, and nearly immune to gunfire.
Nearly killed.
%+d Community Morale.

TutorialText.Text: Having a workshop to make explosives is our best bet against him.

DescriptionText.Text: That guy was just as tough as you'd fear... and faster than you'd expect. - %1$s
Extremely tough. Can be stunned with explosives.
Nearly killed.
%+d Community Morale.
Trying to find a safe spot to hide is a lot harder with so many infestations. - %1$s
Makes the surrounding area a lot more dangerous.
Nearly killed.
Fled from a horde. Now missing.
Fled from a horde. Now missing.

TutorialText.Text: Use the "Train Outsiders" action at the Dojo to accept.

DescriptionText.Text: Seems like we're getting a reputation. Some neighboring survivors asked if they could come train at our dojo. There's 3 cases of ammo in it for us. - %1$s

TutorialText.Text: Use the "Train Outsiders" action at the Shooting Platform to accept.

DescriptionText.Text: Seems like we're getting a reputation. Some neighboring survivors asked if they could come get some firearms training from us. There's 3 cases of ammo in it for us. - %1$s

TutorialText.Text: Look for the "COMMERCE: Library Access" action at the Library.

DescriptionText.Text: Not to toot my own horn, but this library thing's turned out to be a good idea. Another group of survivors has asked to check out our books. There's 2 cases of ammo in it for us. - %1$s

SummaryText.Text: New LIBRARY facility action added temporarily.

TutorialText.Text: Use the "Preserve Food" action at the Storage facility.

DescriptionText.Text: Word's out about us being able to keep food from going bad. Another survivor group has approached us about pickling some vegetables for them. In exchange, we get to keep a portion for ourselves. - %1$s

SummaryText.Text: New Storage facility action added temporarily.

TutorialText.Text: Use the "COMMERCE: Biodiesel" action at the Storage facility.

DescriptionText.Text: Another survivor group has approached us about generating some biodiesel for them. They're offering 5 ammo in exchange. - %1$s

SummaryText.Text: New Storage facility action added temporarily.

TutorialText.Text: An OUTPOST would provide a safe destination for missing friends.

DescriptionText.Text: Still no luck finding %1$s. This would be easier if we had some outposts. - %2$s
%+d Community Morale.

TutorialText.Text: OUTPOSTS provide a safe destination for missing friends.

DescriptionText.Text: %1$s found shelter at one of our outposts. - %2$s
Safe and sound.
Anybody else notice how %1$s just seems to stay calm no matter what? Maybe it should worry me, but I actually find it kind of reassuring. - %2$s
I don't know why you're so fucking relaxed, %1$s. The rest of us seem to understand there is some serious shit going on but you don't. You should get your head examined. - %2$s
I can't say I'm totally relaxed, but when I see %1$s running around, talking like nothing's wrong, it makes me think maybe things aren't quite as bad as I thought. - %2$s
Anybody else notice how %1$s just seems to stay calm no matter what? Maybe it should worry me, but I actually find it kind of reassuring. - %2$s
Anybody else notice how %1$s just seems to stay calm no matter what? Maybe it should worry me, but I actually find it kind of reassuring. - %2$s
Thanks, %1$s. I appreciate what you said. I've been blaming myself for things that aren't under my control. - %2$s
Had a few words of wisdom to share.
There's no point in dwelling on the past. Sure, we aren't all perfect. I'm not perfect either, but I look around and I can tell you one thing: I believe in us. All of us. - %1$s
There's no point in dwelling on the past. Sure, we aren't all perfect. I'm not perfect either, but I look around and I can tell you one thing: I believe in us. All of us. - %1$s
It's sort of an odd couple thing to see the two of them spending so much time together, but I'm glad to see it. Seems like %1$s is a good influence on %2$s. - %3$s
It's sort of an odd couple thing to see the two of them spending so much time together, but I'm glad to see it. Seems like %1$s is a good influence on %2$s. - %3$s
%+d Community Morale.
Has anyone else noticed that %1$s is always getting in everyone's business? - %2$s.
%+d Community Morale.
Has anyone else noticed that %1$s is always getting in everyone's business? - %2$s.
%+d Community Morale.
Sometimes I feel a little lost. %1$s usually knows what we should do, though. That's a good thing. - %2$s.
%+d Community Morale.
Sometimes I feel a little lost. %1$s usually knows what we should do, though. That's a good thing. - %2$s.
Event: New Infestation Spotted
%+d Community Morale.
Event: Morale Drop
%+d Community Morale.

TutorialText.Text: Must clear some INFESTATIONS out.

DescriptionText.Text: Okay, we really need to do something about all these infestations. The more infestations out there, the greater the danger. - %1$s
Worried about community morale.
%+d Community Morale.

TutorialText.Text: Need an infirmary to keep sick people away from everyone else.

DescriptionText.Text: %1$s got %2$s sick.
%+d Community Morale.

TutorialText.Text: Need an infirmary to keep sick people away from everyone else.

DescriptionText.Text: %1$s got %2$s sick.
%+d Community Morale.
%1$s is contagious. Good thing we decided to keep the sick people in the infirmary. The last thing we need is for half the community to be out of commission.

SummaryText.Text: Good thing we had an infirmary.

DescriptionText.Text: Seems like there's a bug going around. It's only a matter of time before it hits us. - %1$s

TutorialText.Text: People will leave if they do not have enough to eat.

DescriptionText.Text: There just isn't enough to eat here. If this keeps up, I... I can't stick around. -%1$s.
Not getting enough food.
Not getting enough food.
Not getting enough food.
Not getting enough food.
Not getting enough food.

TutorialText.Text: BOASTFUL people have their drawbacks.

DescriptionText.Text: Did you see me out there today? I don't mean to brag, but let me just put it this way: There was one point, I'm just looking at this pile of zeds and realizing I actually impressed myself. And that isn't easy. -%1$s.

TutorialText.Text: INSENSITIVE people have their drawbacks.

DescriptionText.Text: Ever notice how the people who suck the most at doing shit also have zero sense of humor? I mean, damn, if you're not a good shot, you could at least try to be good company. -%1$s.

TutorialText.Text: OVERBEARING people have their drawbacks.

DescriptionText.Text: I'll tell you assholes what: You are lucky as hell I'm here. If there was a medal for zombie fighting master, it'd be a gold engraving of my face with a double-fucking rainbow behind it. -%1$s.

Console_Command.Command: LOG: SetEvent Description using new stuff from Lewis!

DescriptionText.Text: %+d Community Morale.

TutorialText.Text: Depressed community members won't pull their weight.

DescriptionText.Text: %1$s has fallen into an actual depression.
%+d Community Morale.

TutorialText.Text: Depressed community members won't pull their weight.

DescriptionText.Text: Not like any of us are gonna get out of this alive. Might as well just mix up a big old batch of cyanide punch and wait for the dark. - %1$s

SummaryText.Text: Might as well lay down and die.

DescriptionText.Text: %+d Community Morale.

TutorialText.Text: Depressed community members won't pull their weight.

DescriptionText.Text: I'm never going to know love again. - %1$s
NEW TRAIT: Depression
%+d Community Morale.

TutorialText.Text: Depressed community members won't pull their weight.

DescriptionText.Text: I mean, is this what we're risking a hideous, painful death for? Living on scraps in the ashes of civilization? - %1$s
%+d Community Morale.

TutorialText.Text: Depressed community members won't pull their weight.

DescriptionText.Text: I'm never going to know love again. - %1$s
%+d Community Morale.

TutorialText.Text: Depressed community members won't pull their weight.

DescriptionText.Text: Me? Don't be silly, I'm perfectly fine. No, I don't know why %2$s said they heard me sobbing last night. Maybe it was somebody else? - %1$s

TutorialText.Text: Depressed community members won't pull their weight.

DescriptionText.Text: I'm really starting to worry about %1$s. Nobody can get them to come out, or even talk to anybody. - %2$s

SummaryText.Text: They've been locked in there for hours.

TutorialText.Text: Depressed community members won't pull their weight.

DescriptionText.Text: %1$s has been acting really weird lately. Like, "contemplating suicide" weird. Somebody better do something. - %2$s

TutorialText.Text: Depressed community members won't pull their weight.

DescriptionText.Text: Had to drag %1$s back to base after that last run. Thought they'd just sit there and wait for the zombies to eat 'em. - %2$s

SummaryText.Text: All the fight's gone out of %1$s.

TutorialText.Text: Depressed community members won't pull their weight.

DescriptionText.Text: %1$s is starting to get that thousand-yard stare. Like something inside 'em just... snapped. - %2$s

SummaryText.Text: It's like %1$s has forgotten everything that makes us human.

TutorialText.Text: Depressed community members won't pull their weight.

DescriptionText.Text: Have you noticed how %1$s is always wearing long sleeves these days? Yeah... it's not THAT chilly yet. - %2$s
%+d Community Morale.

TutorialText.Text: Unhappy community members create instability.

DescriptionText.Text: I'll tell you assholes what: You are lucky as hell I'm here. If there was a medal for zombie fighting master, it'd be a gold engraving of my face with a double-fucking rainbow behind it. -%1$s.
%+d Community Morale.

TutorialText.Text: Fearful community members may panic.

DescriptionText.Text: I came face to face with a screamer today and nearly shit myself. -%1$s.

TutorialText.Text: Some people have moral objections to our choices.

DescriptionText.Text: We've gotten a reputation for being selfish and heartless, and I agree. I can't be a party to this. - %1$s
Disapproves of our reputation.
Disapproves of our reputation.
Disapproves of our reputation.
Disapproves of our reputation.

Event: Food Shortage
Actor Will flee if Hungry
%+d Community Morale.

TutorialText.Text: We need to find more food.

DescriptionText.Text: I haven't eaten an actual meal in weeks. You all can keep starving, I'm out. - %1$s
No longer in the community.
Actor Will flee if Hungry
%+d Community Morale.

TutorialText.Text: We need to find more food.

DescriptionText.Text: Boiled shoe leather is not a food group. I don't care how much you salt it. - %1$s
No longer in the community.
Actor Will flee if Hungry
%+d Community Morale.

TutorialText.Text: We need to find more food.

DescriptionText.Text: Somebody out there has to have some food. I'm going to find them. - %1$s
No longer in the community.
Actor Will flee if Hungry
%+d Community Morale.

TutorialText.Text: We need to find more food.

DescriptionText.Text: Look, I wish you all the best, but you can't eat good wishes. I'll take my chances on my own. - %1$s
No longer in the community.
Actor Will flee if Hungry

TutorialText.Text: We need to find more food.

DescriptionText.Text: No food, no reason for me to stick around. Good luck with the zombies. - %1$s
No longer in the community.
Actor Will flee if Hungry
%+d Community Morale.

TutorialText.Text: We need to find more food.

DescriptionText.Text: I don't care what your favorite book says, hunger isn't a game. I'm out. - %1$s
No longer in the community.
Actor Will flee if Hungry
%+d Community Morale.

TutorialText.Text: We need to find more food.

DescriptionText.Text: Here's a riddle for you: How many cans of tuna does it take to kill a community? Answer: None. - %1$s
No longer in the community.
Actor Will flee if Hungry
%+d Community Morale.

TutorialText.Text: We need to find more food.

DescriptionText.Text: I've fought my last squabble over a stale heel of bread. If you get the food situation sorted out, call me. - %1$s
No longer in the community.

DescriptionText.Text: No food, no reason for me to stick around. Good luck with the zombies. - %1$s

Event: Mishandled Gun
%+d Community Morale.

TutorialText.Text: Maybe we need some FIREARMS TRAINING.

DescriptionText.Text: It just went off! I swear I wasn't screwing around. I definitely wasn't trying to shoot anybody! - %1$s
Was lucky nobody got hurt.
%+d Community Morale.

TutorialText.Text: Maybe we need some FIREARMS TRAINING.

DescriptionText.Text: It's okay everybody! False alarm! Nobody got hurt, it's all good. - %1$s
Was lucky nobody got hurt.
%+d Community Morale.

TutorialText.Text: Maybe we need some FIREARMS TRAINING.

DescriptionText.Text: Holy crap, that was loud! Did you guys know that was gonna be so loud? - %1$s
Was lucky nobody got hurt.
%+d Community Morale.

TutorialText.Text: Maybe we need some FIREARMS TRAINING.

DescriptionText.Text: Dammit, %1$s, you want to stop wasting our ammo AND drawing zombie attention? Clear your chamber before you start cleaning your gun. - %2$s
Was lucky nobody got hurt.
%+d Community Morale.

TutorialText.Text: Maybe we need some FIREARMS TRAINING.

DescriptionText.Text: Geez, that thing coulda exploded in my hand! The hell is wrong with people? - %1$s
Was lucky nobody got hurt.
%+d Community Morale.

TutorialText.Text: Maybe we need some FIREARMS TRAINING.

DescriptionText.Text: Okay, I know I screwed up, and I'm sorry, but at least nobody got hurt... right? - %1$s
%+d Community Morale.

TutorialText.Text: Maybe we need some FIREARMS TRAINING.

DescriptionText.Text: Jesus... somebody coulda died there. We gotta be more careful. - %1$s
%+d Community Morale.

TutorialText.Text: Maybe we need some FIREARMS TRAINING.

DescriptionText.Text: Woo! That one'll wake you up in the morning, huh? Damn near had a heart attack. - %1$s
%+d Community Morale.

TutorialText.Text: Maybe we need some FIREARMS TRAINING.

DescriptionText.Text: Yeah, no, I'm fine. Least I will be when my hands stop shaking. - %1$s
%+d Community Morale.

TutorialText.Text: Maybe we need some FIREARMS TRAINING.

DescriptionText.Text: I am SO sorry, %2$s. You have to know it was an accident. I would never, ever do anything like that intentionally. - %1$s
%+d Community Morale.

TutorialText.Text: Maybe we need some FIREARMS TRAINING.

DescriptionText.Text: Huh. So that's what they mean by "no such thing as an unloaded gun." Sorry %2$s. - %1$s
%+d Community Morale.

TutorialText.Text: Maybe we need some FIREARMS TRAINING.

DescriptionText.Text: In my defense, I was drunk at the time. - %1$s
%+d Community Morale.

TutorialText.Text: Maybe we need some FIREARMS TRAINING.

DescriptionText.Text: This right here is why giving everybody a gun is a bad idea. - %2$s
Event: Deadly Disagreement
%+d Community Morale.
%2$s disrespected me. I sure as shit wasn't going to let that go unanswered. - %1$s

SummaryText.Text: You're lucky that's all you got.

DescriptionText.Text: %2$s knows what he did. - %1$s

SummaryText.Text: Seems like it came out of nowhere.

DescriptionText.Text: %2$s knows what she did. - %1$s

SummaryText.Text: Seems like it came out of nowhere.

DescriptionText.Text: Next person that tries to take what's mine gets worse than that. - %1$s

SummaryText.Text: That was my goddamn pudding cup.

DescriptionText.Text: The Minutemen ARE TOO better than the Goshawks! - %1$s

SummaryText.Text: They're all dead, so who cares?

DescriptionText.Text: Not so tough without your cronies, are you %2$s? - %1$s

SummaryText.Text: Well, that's one way to stop it.

DescriptionText.Text: %2$s is my best buddy, though we sometimes have punch-ups. - %1$s
I don't know what happened, %1$s tried to get %2$s to put on these sunglasses and suddenly it was like Monday Night Wrestling. - Lily

SummaryText.Text: Is it that hard to put them on?

DescriptionText.Text: I don't know what happened, %1$s tried to get %2$s to put on these sunglasses and suddenly it was like Monday Night Wrestling. - Lily

SummaryText.Text: Is it that hard to put them on?

DescriptionText.Text: %+d Community Morale.
Fucker drank the last cup of coffee. %1$s
Oh my God, %1$s just killed %2$s. Kept screaming something about "cheating mother..." well, you know. What do we do? - Lily
I... I think I'm going to be sick. You've never seen so much blood. - Lily
I guess %1$s just couldn't take it any more. - Lily
I didn't mean to kill 'em... Christ, it was an accident! - %1$s
I don't know how it happened, one minute %1$s and %2$s were just arguing, and then there was a gunshot, and %2$s was dead. - Lily
You have any idea how long I've wanted to do that? Dreamed about it? Planned it? Felt good, too.
You have any idea how much of a living hell %2$s made my life? Should have done this years ago. - %1$s
Finally. Maybe now I can have a bunk to myself. - %1$s
I didn't like the look of 'em. Looked like %2$s was about to turn. I did what I had to. - %1$s
%+d Community Morale.
It's a good thing I was here, but we need to deal with %1$s. Next time I might not be around. - %3$s
%+d Community Morale.
I want you to know the only reason %2$s isn't dead yet is because I respect %3$s. But this isn't over. - %1$s
%+d Community Morale.
Everybody just calm down and think about this, okay? - %3$s
%+d Community Morale.
You want %2$s, you've got to go through me. - %3$s
%+d Community Morale.
Damn good thing %3$s was on duty, or we might have lost %1$s.
%+d Community Morale.
It was touch and go for a while there, but %2$s will be okay. Now, what the hell are we going to do about %1$s? - %3$s
%+d Community Morale.
Don't downplay this: if I hadn't been here, %2$s would be dead meat. We need to deal with this situation with %2$s.
%+d Community Morale.
%2$s is stabilized, at least. Could have just as easily gone the other way, though. - %3$s
Event: Ally Fled
%+d Community Morale.

We all saw it coming. %1$s has been more and more nervous lately. Some people just can't take the pressure, and I can't say that there aren't reasons to be scared. Anyway, %1$s is gone now. Ran away. Somehow I doubt we'll be seeing them again. - %2$s

SummaryText.Text: Lost %1$s. Might be able to find them again, though.

DescriptionText.Text: No longer in the community.
%+d Community Morale.

We all saw it coming. %1$s has been more and more nervous lately. Some people just can't take the pressure, and I can't say that there aren't reasons to be scared. Anyway, %1$s is gone now. Ran away. Somehow I doubt we'll be seeing them again. - %2$s

SummaryText.Text: Lost %1$s. Might be able to find them again, though.

DescriptionText.Text: No longer in the community.

I'm sorry. I know what this must look like, but I swear I wouldn't leave if it wasn't important. I met some survivors who said they might've seen my sister over in Danforth. I've got to find a way across the river and see if it's really her. Best of luck to you all. - %1$s

SummaryText.Text: Lost %1$s. Might be able to find them again, though.

DescriptionText.Text: No longer in the community.

NameText.Text: This place is a death trap!

DescriptionText.Text: How much longer do you think this place is gonna last, huh? The zombies KNOW WHERE WE ARE! You can all hole up in your little death trap as long as you want, but hell if I'm going out like that. I'll find my own place. - %1$s

SummaryText.Text: Lost %1$s. Might be able to find them again, though.

DescriptionText.Text: No longer in the community.
%1$s is gone. Nobody seems to know where or why. Guess the fear finally got to 'em. At least it doesn't look like they swiped too much food on the way out. - %2$s

SummaryText.Text: Lost %1$s. Might be able to find them again, though.

DescriptionText.Text: No longer in the community.

Goddammit! We're right in the middle of a supply run and %1$s starts screaming like a baby and rabbits! What the hell ever happened to covering your buddy's back, huh? Well, good riddance, you ask me. - %2$s

SummaryText.Text: Lost %1$s. Might be able to find them again, though.

DescriptionText.Text: No longer in the community.

You all laugh at me, you think I'm crazy, but I'm TELLING you! I saw that same zombie in the green jacket outside my window AGAIN last night! It's STALKING me! I've got to get out of here... BEFORE IT FINDS ITS WAY IN! - %1$s

SummaryText.Text: Lost %1$s. Might be able to find them again, though.

DescriptionText.Text: No longer in the community.
%+d Community Morale.

I saw what you did. And I know you know I saw it. I'm not going to out you, okay? In fact, I'm just going to leave. Nobody will ever find out from me. Okay? So there's no reason to come after me. - %1$s

SummaryText.Text: Lost %1$s. Might be able to find them again, though.

DescriptionText.Text: No longer in the community.
You all think it's funny? Huh? The "pranks," the stolen food, the blanket parties when nobody's looking? Fuck all of you. Especially you, %2$s. - %1$s

SummaryText.Text: Lost %1$s. Might be able to find them again, though.

DescriptionText.Text: No longer in the community.

You're all nuts, you know. Squatting in what's left of civilization--where do you think all the zombies are concentrated? There's 8,000 acres of national park just on the other side of those mountains. Keep your Tartan Marts and Swines & Bovines, I'll go live in the woods. How hard can it be? - %1$s

SummaryText.Text: Lost %1$s. Might be able to find them again, though.

DescriptionText.Text: No longer in the community.
Has anybody seen %1$s? They're way overdue, and from the way they've been acting lately, I'm afraid they might have run off. -- %2$s

SummaryText.Text: Lost %1$s. Might be able to find them again, though.

DescriptionText.Text: No longer in the community.
%1$s was going to abandon us, but luckily %2$s has a sixth sense about these kinds of things.
Event: Suicide
%+d Community Morale.
%1$s committed suicide. I guess we all saw it coming, but nobody did anything to stop it. There was no note. - Lily
Goodbye, cruel world. I die as I lived: an enormous cliche. - %1$s
I'm sorry. I know I let you down, I know this is a coward's way out, but I just can't. I'll see you soon, Mama. - %1$s
None of you gave a shit about me while I was alive, so why should you after I'm gone? You'll probably just use this note for toilet paper or something. - %1$s
Don't worry. I made sure the shot would destroy my brain. I'm not going to turn on you. At least I can do that part right. - %1$s
This is the only way out. %1$s
If anyone finds my mother, tell her I'm sorry. I wasn't strong enough. %1$s
There are supposed to be a lot of painless ways to do this. Course, all of them end with me turning, so I guess it's bullet in the head time. Fuck you, zombies. - %1$s
I hope the rest of you make it. I really do. But I just can't face another day of this shit. - %1$s
You could have prevented this. It's not like I exactly kept it to myself. All somebody had to do was say something, but I guess your "supply runs" are more important. Fuck you. - %1$s
Disaster averted

SummaryText.Text: %1$s was in a bad place, but %2$s managed to talk them out of doing anything stupid.

DescriptionText.Text: Suddenly, I'm the asshole for trying to bring a little levity to the situation? It's not like everyone didn't know it was you crying yourself to sleep, %2$s. (Besides, I thought it was a pretty damn good impression.) - %1$s
So I think I owe %2$s an apology. I thought everyone knew what I said things like 'punk ass bitch' and 'unbelievable crybaby' that was just good natured ribbing. I was wrong. - %1$s

I needed a little quiet time to get my head straight after all the shit that's been going down. Nothing weird about that. If you've got a problem with that, %1$s, how about you quit with the wisecracks and try saying so to my face? - %2$s
So we all know %2$s has been moping around lately. Fine, your way of coping is being a mopey bitch. My way is cracking jokes. There's no need to get all offended. - %1$s
So I think I owe %2$s an apology. I thought everyone knew what I said things like 'punk ass bitch' and 'unbelievable crybaby' that was just good natured ribbing. I was wrong. - %1$s

TutorialText.Text: OVERBEARING people have their drawbacks.

DescriptionText.Text: Leave me alone, asshole. Somebody remind me why %1$s is here. Other than to annoy the shit out of me. - %2$s.

TutorialText.Text: BOASTFUL people may rub others the wrong way.

DescriptionText.Text: Sometimes I wish %1$s would just shut up. Yeah, yeah, I get it. You're great. I'm not. - %2$s.

TutorialText.Text: BOASTFUL people may rub others the wrong way.

DescriptionText.Text: Jesus. I'm getting tired of %1$s always trying to one-up me. Some people talk way too much, you know what I mean? - %2$s.
Event: Food poisoning
%+d Community Morale.

TutorialText.Text: Assigning someone to staff your kitchen reduces the risk of food poisoning.

DescriptionText.Text: Feels like a bunch of tiny goblins are doing a clog dance through my bowels. This is what we get for not having someone who knows how to cook worth a damn. - %1$s

Stamina penalty.

TutorialText.Text: Good thing %1$s was here.

DescriptionText.Text: Guys, guys, guys... for the last time, if there's fuzz on the bread, you throw it out. We can't eat this! - %1$s

TutorialText.Text: Good thing %1$s was here.

DescriptionText.Text: You're lucky you've got me keeping an eye on the kitchen. You know what would have happened if you ate this? - %1$s

DescriptionText.Text: We missed a catastrophic case of the shits by THAT much. We gotta be more careful with our food.

Food poisoning. Got a couple of us. This is what we get for not having someone who knows how to cook worth a damn.
%+d Community Morale.
Well, they do say misery loves company....

This one was really bad. Two people down, and it's just dumb luck it wasn't more.

Nobody wants to be the first to say it, but things are not going well around here. - %1$s

Console_Command.Command: LOG: Up to four characters abandon the community.

DescriptionText.Text: We did a few good things today. I'll grant you that. - %1$s

SummaryText.Text: Selfless actions are helping keep the peace.

DescriptionText.Text: %+d Community Morale.

TutorialText.Text: We need a KITCHEN

DescriptionText.Text: Feels like a bunch of tiny goblins are doing a clog dance through my bowels. This is what we get for not having a proper place to prepare our food.
%+d Community Morale.
There's something about a well-maintained kitchen that makes everything feel almost normal.
%+d Community Morale.

TutorialText.Text: Need an infirmary to keep sick people away from everyone else.

DescriptionText.Text: %1$s got %2$s sick.
%+d Community Morale.
%1$s is contagious. Good thing we decided to keep the sick people in the infirmary. The last thing we need is for half the community to be out of commission.

SummaryText.Text: Good thing we had an Infirmary.

DescriptionText.Text: %+d Community Morale.

TutorialText.Text: An infirmary would help.

DescriptionText.Text: %1$s has the flu. We knew it was going around, but didn't prepare. - %2$s
%+d Cases of Medicine
We've had a couple of people showing flu-like symptoms. We're churning through meds trying to keep everyone well. - %1$s
%+d Community Morale.

TutorialText.Text: An infirmary would help.

DescriptionText.Text: %2$s got me sick. We need an infirmary and sick people need to stay in it. - %1$s
%+d Cases of Medicine
We're burning through meds at an alarming rate. I think everyone's a little paranoid about getting sick. - %1$s
%+d Community Morale.

TutorialText.Text: We need ammo and a guard tower.

DescriptionText.Text: A feral made it inside the walls. %2$s was torn apart. - %1$s.

TutorialText.Text: We need ammo and a guard tower.

DescriptionText.Text: A feral made it inside the walls. We managed to take it out without any deaths, but %2$s was wounded. - %1$s.
Cannot help with missions or provide labor until the wound heals.

TutorialText.Text: We need ammo and a guard tower.

DescriptionText.Text: A feral made it inside the walls. %2$s was torn apart. - %1$s.

TutorialText.Text: We're safe as long as we have ammo and a guard tower.

DescriptionText.Text: Spotted a Feral on its way toward us and took it out before it became a threat. - %1$s.
%+d Community Morale.

TutorialText.Text: Having a workshop to make explosives is our best bet against him.

DescriptionText.Text: Killed by a Juggernaut

TutorialText.Text: Having a workshop to make explosives is our best bet against him.

DescriptionText.Text: A big boy made it inside the walls. We managed to take it out without any deaths, but %2$s was wounded. - %1$s.
Cannot help with missions or provide labor until the wound heals.

TutorialText.Text: Having a workshop to make explosives is our best bet against him.

DescriptionText.Text: Killed by a Juggernaut

TutorialText.Text: Using explosives made in the workshop was key.

DescriptionText.Text: Spotted a Juggernaut on its way toward us. We were able to use explosives to take it out. - %1$s.
Event: Near death experience.
%+d Community Morale.

TutorialText.Text: Low Morale puts your community at greater risk of depression, violence, and despair.

DescriptionText.Text: With so many hordes out there, our people are in constant danger. - %1$s
Their numbers make them dangerous.
Nearly killed.
